item.title: 洛佩斯·奥夫拉多尔表示墨西哥和中国将保持互利关系
item.description:
Mexico and China have committed to maintain a mutually beneficial relationship, Mexico President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Thursday after a meeting with his Chinese counterpart.翻译:墨西哥总统安德烈斯·曼努埃尔·洛佩斯·奥夫拉多尔周四在与中国总统会晤后表示，墨西哥和中国致力于维持互利关系。

The two met on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit in San Francisco.翻译:两人在旧金山亚太经济合作组织（APEC）峰会期间会面。

China and Mexico's relationship has strengthened with time, Chinese President Xi Jinping said about the meeting, according to a post from the Asian country's embassy in Mexico.翻译:据亚洲国家驻墨西哥大使馆发布的消息，中国国家主席习近平在谈到此次会面时表示，中国和墨西哥的关系随着时间的推移而不断加强。

Lopez Obrador is set to meet later on Thursday with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, and with his U.S. counterpart President Joe Biden on Friday.翻译:洛佩兹·奥夫拉多尔定于周四晚些时候与加拿大总理贾斯汀·特鲁多会面，并于周五与美国总统乔·拜登会面。

The Biden administration has been seeking increased cooperation from both Mexico and China to stem the flow of fentanyl, a deadly opioid, and its precursor chemicals, which have fueled a sharp rise in overdose deaths in the United States.翻译:拜登政府一直在寻求墨西哥和中国加强合作，以阻止芬太尼（一种致命的阿片类药物）及其前体化学品的流动，这些化学品导致美国服药过量死亡人数急剧上升。

Reporting by Kylie Madry and Valentine Hilaire; Editing by Josie Kao翻译:凯莉·马德里和瓦伦丁·希莱尔报道；编辑：高乔茜

item.title: 美国议员对中国自动驾驶测试数据收集表示担忧
item.description:
A bipartisan group of U.S. lawmakers raised alarm about Chinese companies collecting and handling sensitive data while testing autonomous vehicles in the United States, according to letters seen by Reuters on Thursday.翻译:根据路透社周四看到的信件，一个由美国两党议员组成的小组对中国公司在美国测试自动驾驶汽车时收集和处理敏感数据提出了警告。

The lawmakers, including House of Representatives Energy and Commerce Committee Chair Cathy McMorris Rodgers and China select committee Chair Mike Gallagher, asked 10 Chinese-related companies to answer questions by Nov. 29 on data collection practices from ongoing autonomous vehicle testing in California and elsewhere.翻译:包括众议院能源和商务委员会主席凯西·麦克莫里斯·罗杰斯和中国特别委员会主席迈克·加拉格尔在内的立法者要求 10 家与中国相关的公司在 11 月 29 日之前回答有关加州和其他地方正在进行的自动驾驶汽车测试的数据收集实践的问题。

The companies - including Baidu (9888.HK), Nio (9866.HK), WeRide, Didi Chuxing, Xpeng (9868.HK), Inceptio, Pony.ai, AutoX, Deeproute.ai and Qcraft - did not respond to requests for comment or could not immediately be reached.翻译:这些公司——包括百度（9888.HK） 、蔚来汽车（9866.HK） 、文远知行、滴滴出行、小鹏汽车（9868.HK） 、嬴彻科技、小马智行、AutoX、Deeproute.ai 和 Qcraft——均未回应请求。发表评论或无法立即联系到。

The previously unreported letters, also signed by Democrats Frank Pallone and Raja Krishnamoorti and 10 other lawmakers, said the companies "collect sensitive information about our citizens and their daily routines, the nation's infrastructure, and connected technologies."翻译:此前未报道的信件也由民主党人 Frank Pallone 和 Raja Krishnamoorti 以及其他 10 名立法者签署，信中称这些公司“收集有关我们公民及其日常生活、国家基础设施和互联技术的敏感信息”。

"There needs to be greater transparency around what information you collect while testing on American roads, and whether you are financially tied to the Chinese Communist Party," according to the previously unreported letters.翻译:根据此前未报道的信件，“在美国道路测试时收集的信息以及您是否与中国共产党有经济联系，需要提高透明度。”

The lawmakers asked what data is collected in the United States, whether it is stored in China, and if it is shared with the Chinese government or others. They also asked if the vehicles collect data on U.S. infrastructure during testing.翻译:议员们询问美国收集了哪些数据，这些数据是否存储在中国，以及是否与中国政府或其他方共享。他们还询问这些车辆是否在测试期间收集有关美国基础设施的数据。

The letters said in the 12 months ended November 2022 that Chinese AV companies test drove more than 450,000 miles in California. In July, Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg said his agency had national security concerns about Chinese autonomous vehicle companies in the United States.翻译:这些信件称，截至 2022 年 11 月的 12 个月内，中国自动驾驶汽车公司在加州试驾了超过 45 万英里。 7 月，交通部长皮特·布蒂吉格 (Pete Buttigieg) 表示，他的机构对中国自动驾驶汽车公司在美国的国家安全感到担忧。

"Whether we are talking about hardware or software, in the same way there are concerns around telecom or TikTok, there are concerns around transportation technologies," Buttigieg told Reuters.翻译:布蒂吉格对路透社表示：“无论我们谈论硬件还是软件，就像对电信或 TikTok 的担忧一样，对交通技术也存在担忧。”

Reporting by David Shepardson; editing by Jonathan Oatis and Richard Chang翻译:大卫·谢泼德森报道；乔纳森·奥蒂斯和理查德·张编辑
item.author: David Shepardson

item.title: 拜登取消对中国研究所的制裁以推动芬太尼帮助
item.description:
The Biden administration on Thursday removed the Chinese Ministry of Public Security's Institute of Forensic Science from a trade sanction list, part of a bid to convince Beijing to do more to halt the flow of the synthetic opioid fentanyl into the United States.翻译:拜登政府周四将中国公安部法证科学研究所从贸易制裁名单中删除，此举是为了说服北京采取更多措施阻止合成阿片类药物芬太尼流入美国。

Washington put the institute on the list in 2020 over alleged abuses against Uyghurs and other minority groups, effectively barring it from receiving most goods from U.S. suppliers.翻译:华盛顿因涉嫌虐待维吾尔族和其他少数群体而于 2020 年将该研究所列入名单，实际上禁止该研究所接收来自美国供应商的大部分商品。

Former Chinese ambassador to the U.S. Qin Gang last year described it as "shocking" that the U.S., which had expressed frustration over Beijing's lack of cooperation on fentanyl, would sanction an institute he described as essential to controlling the drug.翻译:中国前驻美国大使秦刚去年表示，美国对北京在芬太尼问题上缺乏合作表示失望，却对一个他认为对控制芬太尼至关重要的机构实施制裁，这“令人震惊”。

The Chinese embassy in Washington did not immediately respond to a request for comment.翻译:中国驻华盛顿大使馆没有立即回应置评请求。

Reuters had previously reported the institute would be removed as Biden sought more cooperation from Beijing on fentanyl in a meeting with China's President Xi Jinping on Wednesday in San Francisco at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum.翻译:路透社此前曾报道称，由于拜登周三在旧金山亚太经合组织(APEC)论坛上与中国国家主席习近平会面，寻求在芬太尼问题上与北京方面进行更多合作，该研究所将被撤销。

As part of the meeting, the men agreed to create a working group on counter-narcotics cooperation. The White House's National Security Council did not respond to a request for comment on what, beyond creating the working group, China pledged to do to stem shipments of the deadly narcotic.翻译:作为会议的一部分，双方同意成立一个禁毒合作工作组。白宫国家安全委员会没有回应记者的置评请求，即除了成立工作组之外，中国还承诺采取哪些行动来阻止这种致命毒品的运输。

The move was criticized by human rights activists and Republicans, who accused the Biden administration of going soft on Beijing over its treatment of Uyghurs.翻译:此举遭到人权活动人士和共和党人的批评，他们指责拜登政府在北京对待维吾尔人的问题上态度软弱。

Rayhan Asat, a human rights lawyer of Uyghur heritage, said she recognized the pressing issue posed by fentanyl, but that the U.S. decision raised questions about U.S. commitment to addressing China's rights abuses.翻译:维吾尔族人权律师雷汉·阿萨特(Rayhan Asat)表示，她认识到芬太尼带来的紧迫问题，但美国的决定引发了人们对美国解决中国侵犯人权问题的承诺的质疑。

"The United States has a legal obligation, under federal law, to address atrocity crimes once they have been determined as such. The question then arises: should addressing one issue take precedence over addressing the genocide? Can't we address both?" she said.翻译:“根据联邦法律，一旦确定暴行罪，美国就有法律义务解决这些罪行。那么问题就出现了：解决一个问题是否应该优先于解决种族灭绝问题？我们不能同时解决这两个问题吗？”她说。

Blocking fentanyl "precursor" chemicals has been a priority for Washington as the rate of overdose deaths involving the drug more than tripled from 2016 through 2021, according to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).翻译:根据美国疾病控制与预防中心 (CDC) 的数据，从 2016 年到 2021 年，涉及芬太尼“前体”化学品的过量死亡率增加了两倍多，因此封锁芬太尼“前体”化学品一直是华盛顿的首要任务。

The removal, according to a notice posted in the Federal Register, came after a "removal proposal" was received and reviewed, the department said in the posting, by a committee composed of representatives of the departments of Commerce, State, Defense, Energy, and sometimes, the Treasury.翻译:根据《联邦公报》上发布的通知，该部门在收到并审查了“删除提案”后进行了删除，该委员会由商务部、国务院、国防部、能源部、有时，还有财政部。

Reporting by Alexandra Alper, Michael Martina and Paul Grant; Editing by Doina Chiacu, Chizu Nomiyama and Josie Kao翻译:亚历山德拉·阿尔珀 (Alexandra Alper)、迈克尔·马丁纳 (Michael Martina) 和保罗·格兰特 (Paul Grant) 报道；编辑：Doina Chiacu、Chizu Nomiyama 和 Josie Kao

item.title: 拜登和习近平“直言不讳”的会谈达成了军事、芬太尼方面的协议
item.description:
U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping agreed on Wednesday to open a presidential hotline, resume military-to-military communications and work to curb fentanyl production, showing tangible progress in their first face-to-face talks in a year.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登和中国领导人习近平周三同意开通总统热线、恢复军队间沟通以及遏制芬太尼生产，这在一年来首次面对面会谈中取得了切实进展。

Biden and Xi met for about four hours on the outskirts of San Francisco to discuss issues that have strained U.S.-Chinese relations. Simmering differences remain, particularly over Taiwan.翻译:拜登和习近平在旧金山郊区会面约四个小时，讨论导致美中关系紧张的问题。分歧依然存在，尤其是在台湾问题上。

In a significant breakthrough, the two governments plan to resume military contacts that China severed after then-House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan in August 2022.翻译:两国政府计划恢复中国在时任众议院议长南希·佩洛西于 2022 年 8 月访问台湾后中断的军事接触，这是一项重大突破。

“We’re back to direct, open clear direct communication on a direct basis,” Biden said.翻译:拜登说：“我们回到了直接、公开、明确的直接沟通。”

In addition, Biden said he and Xi agreed to high-level communications.翻译:拜登表示，他和习近平同意进行高层沟通。 "He and I agreed that each one of us can pick up the phone call directly and we'll be heard immediately."

But in a comment likely to irk the Chinese, Biden told reporters later that he had not changed his view that Xi is a dictator.翻译:但拜登后来对记者表示，他并没有改变对习近平是独裁者的看法，这可能会激怒中国人。

"Well, look, he is. I mean, he’s a dictator in the sense that he is a guy who runs a country that is a communist country," Biden said.翻译:“嗯，看，他是。我的意思是，他是一个独裁者，因为他管理着一个共产主义国家，”拜登说。

Xi told Biden that the negative views of the Communist Party in the United States were unfair, a U.S. official told reporters after the meeting.翻译:一位美国官员在会后告诉记者，习近平告诉拜登，美国共产党的负面看法是不公平的。

Biden and Xi came into the talks looking to smooth over a rocky period in relations that took a turn for the worse after a suspected Chinese surveillance balloon transited the United States and was shot down by a U.S. fighter jet in February.翻译:拜登和习近平参加会谈是为了缓和两国关系的不稳定时期，自二月份一个疑似中国监视气球飞越美国并被一架美国战斗机击落后，两国关系变得更糟。

The White House said Biden raised areas where Washington has concerns, including detained U.S. citizens, human rights in Xinjiang, Tibet and Hong Kong and Beijing’s aggressive activities in the South China Sea.翻译:白宫表示，拜登提出了华盛顿关切的领域，包括被拘留的美国公民、新疆、西藏和香港的人权以及北京在南中国海的侵略活动。

"Just talking, just being blunt with one another so there’s no misunderstanding," Biden said.

MILITARY, TAIWAN

U.S. and China's militaries have had a number of near-misses and acrimonious exchanges over the past year. After the pledge to renew communications, U.S. Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin will meet his Chinese counterpart when that person is named, a senior U.S. official said.翻译:过去一年里，美国和中国军队发生了多次险些失手和激烈的交锋。一位美国高级官员表示，在承诺恢复沟通后，美国国防部长劳埃德·奥斯汀将在中国国防部长被任命后与其会面。

Biden and Xi agreed China would stem the export of items related to the production of the opioid fentanyl, a leading cause of drug overdoses in the United States. "It’s going to save lives,” Biden said, adding he appreciated Xi’s “commitment” on the issue.翻译:拜登和习近平一致同意，中国将阻止与阿片类药物芬太尼生产相关的产品出口， 阿片类药物芬太尼是美国吸毒过量的主要原因。拜登说：“这将拯救生命。”他补充说，他赞赏习近平在这个问题上的“承诺”。

Under the agreement, China will go directly after specific chemical companies that make fentanyl precursors, a senior U.S. official told reporters. He vowed to "trust but verify" Chinese actions on the drug.翻译:一位美国高级官员告诉记者，根据协议，中国将直接打击生产芬太尼前体的特定化学公司。他发誓要“信任但核实”中国对该药物的行动。

The two leaders also agreed to get experts together to discuss the risks of artificial intelligence.翻译:两位领导人还同意召集专家讨论人工智能的风险。

A U.S. official described an exchange over Taiwan, the democratic island that China claims as its territory. China's preference is for peaceful reunification with the Chinese-claimed island of Taiwan, Xi told Biden, the U.S. official said, but Xi went on to talk about conditions in which force could be used.翻译:一名美国官员描述了一场围绕台湾问题的交流，中国声称台湾是其领土。这位美国官员表示，习近平告诉拜登，中国倾向于和平统一中国声称拥有主权的台湾岛，但习近平接着谈到了可以使用武力的条件。

Biden said he stressed the need for peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait. The U.S. official said Biden argued to maintain the status quo and for China to respect Taiwan's electoral process.翻译:拜登表示，他强调台海需要和平与稳定。这位美国官员表示，拜登主张维持现状，并要求中国尊重台湾的选举程序。

"President Xi responded 'Look, peace is all well and good, but at some point we need to move towards resolution more generally'," the official quoted Xi as saying.翻译:这位官员援引习近平的话说：“习主席回应道，‘看，和平固然很好，但在某些时候我们需要更广泛地解决问题’。”

Xi also urged the United States to stop sending weapons to Taiwan and support China's peaceful "reunification" with Taiwan, Chinese state media said.翻译:中国官方媒体称，习近平还敦促美国停止向台湾运送武器，支持中国与台湾和平“统一”。

Bonnie Glaser, a Taiwan expert at the Germen Marshall Fund of the United States, said Xi seemed to have conveyed both threats and assurances on Taiwan.翻译:美国德国马歇尔基金会台湾问题专家葛来仪表示，习近平似乎既传达了对台湾的威胁，又传达了保证。

"The suggestion that a resolution needs to be found in the near term is a worrisome sign, even if he emphasized that there are no plans for military action against Taiwan in the coming years," she said.翻译:“尽管他强调未来几年没有计划对台湾采取军事行动，但需要在短期内找到解决方案的建议是一个令人担忧的迹象，”她说。

Biden said he asked Xi to use his influence with Iran to urge Tehran not to launch proxy attacks on U.S. targets in the Middle East as the Israel-Hamas conflict continues in Gaza.

RESPECT AND WARMTH

Biden welcomed the Chinese leader at the Filoli estate, a country house and well-manicured gardens about 30 miles (48 km) south of San Francisco, where they will move later for a summit of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum.翻译:拜登在位于旧金山以南约 30 英里（48 公里）的菲洛丽庄园迎接了中国领导人，菲洛丽庄园是一座乡间别墅，花园修剪整齐，稍后他们将前往那里参加亚太经济合作组织 (APEC) 论坛峰会。

APEC meets amid relative Chinese economic weakness, Beijing's territorial feuds with neighbors and a Middle East conflict that is dividing the United States from allies.翻译:亚太经合组织召开之际， 中国经济相对疲软，北京与邻国之间存在领土争端，而中东冲突则导致美国与盟友分裂。

Xi came into the meeting looking for respect from the United States as China's economy struggles to recover from sluggish growth.翻译:在中国经济努力从增长乏力中复苏之际，习近平参加会议是为了寻求美国的尊重。

Biden, who had long sought the meeting, struck a warm, welcoming tone. Video of the two clasping hands in farewell after the meeting was posted on X by the Global Times, China's state-backed tabloid.翻译:拜登长期以来一直寻求这次会面，他的语气热情而欢迎。中国官方小报《环球时报》在X上发布了两人会面后握手告别的视频。

"Planet Earth is big enough for the two countries to succeed," Xi told Biden as they and their delegations sat across from each other at a long table in an ornate conference room.翻译:“地球足够大，足以让两国取得成功，”习近平和两国代表团在一间华丽的会议室里面对面坐在一张长桌旁时对拜登说。

Biden said the U.S. and China had to ensure that competition between them "does not veer into conflict" and manage their relationship "responsibly."翻译:拜登表示，美国和中国必须确保两国之间的竞争“不会演变成冲突”，并“负责任地” 管理两国关系。

After lunch, the leaders took a short walk together in the manicured garden of the mansion following an interaction that lasted around four hours. Biden waved to reporters and gave a two thumbs up sign when asked how the talks were going. "Well," he said.翻译:午餐后，两位领导人在豪宅修剪整齐的花园里一起散步，并进行了大约四个小时的互动。当被问及谈判进展如何时，拜登向记者挥手并竖起两个大拇指。 “好吧，”他说。

Xi told Biden as they began their talks a lot had happened since their last meeting a year ago in Bali, citing the impacts of the COVID pandemic, and calling the U.S.-China relationship "the most important bilateral relationship in the world."翻译:习近平在会谈开始时告诉拜登，自一年前上次在巴厘岛举行会议以来发生了很多事情，并提到了新冠病毒大流行的影响，并称美中关系是“世界上最重要的双边关系”。

"For two large countries like China and the United States, turning their back on each other is not an option," he said. "It is unrealistic for one side to remodel the other."翻译:“对于中国和美国这样的两个大国来说，互相背弃不是一个选择，”他说。 “一方改造另一方是不现实的。”

After the two met, Biden welcomed global leaders to the APEC meeting in San Francisco, where he said Xi regarded the visit as a homecoming given the city’s large Chinese population.翻译:两人会面后，拜登欢迎全球领导人出席在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织会议，他表示，鉴于该市华人人口众多，习近平将这次访问视为一次回家。

item.title: 拜登在精心策划的峰会后称习近平为独裁者
item.description:
U.S. President Joe Biden said on Wednesday he had not changed his view that Chinese President Xi Jinping was effectively a dictator, a comment likely to land with a thud in Beijing after the two leaders held straightforward summit talks.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登周三表示，他没有改变对中国国家主席习近平实际上是独裁者的看法，在两国领导人举行直截了当的峰会会谈后，这一言论可能会在北京引起轰动。

Biden held a solo news conference after four hours of talks with Xi on the outskirts of San Francisco. At the end of the news conference, he was asked whether he still held the view that Xi was a dictator, something he said in June.翻译:拜登在旧金山郊区与习近平进行了四个小时的会谈后举行了单独的新闻发布会。在新闻发布会结束时，他被问到是否仍然认为习近平是独裁者，他在六月份曾说过这样的话。

"Look, he is. He's a dictator in the sense that he's a guy who runs a country that is a communist country that's based on a form of government totally different than ours," Biden said.翻译:“看，他是。从某种意义上说，他是一个独裁者，因为他统治着一个共产主义国家，而这个国家的政府形式与我们的政府完全不同，”拜登说。

In response, China's foreign ministry said it "strongly opposes" the remarks, without mentioning Biden by name.翻译:作为回应，中国外交部表示“强烈反对”上述言论，但没有提及拜登的名字。

"This statement is extremely wrong and irresponsible political manipulation," foreign ministry spokesperson Mao Ning told reporters on Thursday at a routine briefing.翻译:外交部发言人毛宁在周四的例行记者会上对记者说：“这种说法是极其错误的，是不负责任的政治操弄。”

"It should be pointed out that there will always be some people with ulterior motives who attempt to incite and damage U.S.-China relations, they are doomed to fail."翻译:需要指出的是，总会有一些别有用心的人企图煽动和破坏美中关系，他们注定不会得逞。”

Mao refused to specify the identity of "some people" in answer to a follow-up question.翻译:毛泽东在回答后续问题时拒绝具体说明“一些人”的身份。

Last March Xi clinched a third term as president when nearly 3,000 members of China's rubber-stamp parliament, the National People's Congress, voted unanimously for him in an election in which there was no other candidate.翻译:去年3月，习近平获得了国家主席的第三个任期，当时中国橡皮图章议会（全国人民代表大会）的近3000名议员在没有其他候选人的选举中一致投票支持他。

Xi is considered the most powerful Chinese leader since Mao Zedong, after a decade of consolidating power in policy-making and the military, and stifling media freedoms.翻译:习近平被认为是自毛泽东以来最强大的中国领导人， 十年来巩固了决策和军队的权力，并压制了媒体自由。

There was no immediate reaction from the Chinese delegation, which had come to the United States to attend the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in San Francisco. Hundreds of critics of Beijing marched through the city's downtown around noon, chanting "free Tibet" and "free Hong Kong."

When Biden made a similar dictator reference in June, China called the remarks absurd and a provocation. But the spat did not prevent the two sides from holding extensive talks aimed at improving strained relations, which culminated in Wednesday's meeting.翻译:当拜登六月份发表类似的独裁者言论时，中国称其言论荒谬且是挑衅。但这场口角并没有阻止双方举行旨在改善紧张关系的广泛会谈，会谈在周三的会面中达到顶峰。

Writing by Steve Holland; Additional reporting by Laurie Chen in Beijing; Editing by Heather Timmons, Stephen Coates and Raju Gopalakrishnan翻译:史蒂夫·霍兰德 (Steve Holland) 撰写； Laurie Chen 在北京的补充报道；编辑：Heather Timmons、Stephen Coates 和 Raju Gopalakrishnan

item.title: 习近平表示中国已准备好成为APEC合作伙伴
item.description:
Summary:
  • Xi attends dinner with US executives, officials
  • Apple, BlackRock, Pfizer among the firms represented
  • Controversy over reported high ticket cost
翻译:概括：
  • 习近平与美国高管和官员共进晚餐
  • 代表公司包括苹果、贝莱德、辉瑞
  • 票价高引发争议

China is ready to be a partner and friend of the United States, and there is plenty of room for bilateral cooperation, President Xi Jinping told American executives in San Francisco on Wednesday, as Beijing looks to reassure global business and counter his country's struggles to entice foreign investment.翻译:周三，国家主席习近平在旧金山对美国高管表示，中国已准备好成为美国的伙伴和朋友，双边合作还有很大空间，北京方面希望安抚全球企业，并应对中国在吸引全球企业方面的努力。外来投资。

The U.S. executives dined with Xi on the margins of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum following a day of talks between the Chinese leader and U.S. President Joe Biden, aimed at steadying relations between the world's two largest economies.翻译:在中国领导人与美国总统乔·拜登进行了一天的会谈后，美国高管在亚太经合组织（APEC）论坛间隙与习近平共进晚餐，会谈旨在稳定世界两大经济体之间的关系。

Xi received a standing ovation as he entered the room, and two more before and after he took the stage to speak.翻译:习近平一走进房间就受到了全场起立鼓掌，在他上台讲话前后，又有两次起立鼓掌。

The world needs China and the U.S. to work together, and it is wrong to view China as a threat and play a zero-sum game against it, Xi said in a speech to the audience, including some hand-picked by Beijing.翻译:习近平在向观众发表的讲话中表示，世界需要中美共同努力，将中国视为威胁并与之玩零和游戏的做法是错误的。

"Whatever stage of development it may reach, China will never pursue hegemony or expansion, and will never impose its will on others. China does not seek spheres of influence, and will not fight a cold war or a hot war with anyone," Xi said.翻译:“无论发展到什么阶段，中国永远不称霸、永远不扩张，永远不会把自己的意志强加于人。中国不谋求势力范围，不会同任何人打冷战、热战。”说。

He assured his audience that "no matter how the global landscape evolves, the historical trend of peaceful coexistence between China and the United States will not change."翻译:他向观众保证，“无论世界格局如何变化，中美和平共处的历史潮流都不会改变”。

Xi's optimistic tone toward relations with the U.S. was at odds with the negative chorus of voices in Washington, where the U.S. Congress finds unusual bipartisan consensus in the need to counter Beijing.翻译:习近平对中美关系的乐观态度与华盛顿的负面声音不一致，美国国会发现两党在对抗北京方面达成了不同寻常的共识。

The high-security dinner was a chance for companies to hear directly from China's leader as they search for ways to navigate China's economic slowdown, a U.S. push to "de-risk" some American supply chains away from China, and uncertainty caused by China's expanding security rules.翻译:这次高度安全的晚宴为企业提供了直接听取中国领导人讲话的机会，因为它们正在寻找应对中国经济放缓、美国推动部分美国供应链远离中国“降低风险”以及中国扩张带来的不确定性的方法。安全规则。

Executives from U.S. corporate giants such as Apple's (AAPL.O) Tim Cook, BlackRock's (BLK.N) Laurence Fink, Broadcom's (AVGO.O) Hock Tan, Bridgewater Associates' Ray Dalio and Pfizer's (PFE.N) Albert Bourla were at the dinner tables.翻译:苹果(AAPL.O)蒂姆·库克 (Tim Cook)、贝莱德(BLK.N)劳伦斯·芬克 (Laurence Fink)、博通(AVGO.O) Hock Tan、Bridgewater Associates 雷·达里奥 (Ray Dalio) 和辉瑞(PFE.N)艾伯特·布尔拉 (Albert Bourla) 等美国企业巨头的高管出席了会议。餐桌。

Xi also met Tesla (TSLA.O) CEO Elon Musk, telling him that he supports the company's development in China, according to a statement from the auto maker's Weibo Account on Thursday.翻译:根据特斯拉微博周四发布的声明，习近平还会见了特斯拉(TSLA.O)首席执行官埃隆·马斯克，告诉他支持该公司在中国的发展。

The dinner, where courses served included coffee-crusted black angus flat iron steak and a vegetable curry with squash and rice, attracted nearly 400 people, including government officials and academics.翻译:晚宴上的菜肴包括咖啡皮黑安格斯扁铁牛排和蔬菜咖喱配南瓜和米饭，吸引了近 400 人参加，其中包括政府官员和学者。

But Xi directed much of his speech toward the American people and spent little time on commercial relations with the U.S.翻译:但习近平的讲话大部分针对美国人民，很少讨论与美国的商业关系

"I would like to let you know that China sympathizes deeply with the American people, especially the young, for the sufferings that fentanyl has inflicted upon them," he said.翻译:他说：“我想让你知道，中方对美国人民特别是年轻人因芬太尼给他们造成的痛苦深表同情。”

Biden and Xi earlier reached an agreement on working together to curb fentanyl production.

CONTROVERSY

U.S. Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo and other senior U.S. officials also attended the event, which generated controversy due to reported high ticket costs for companies seeking to brush shoulders with Xi.翻译:美国商务部长吉娜·雷蒙多和其他美国高级官员也出席了此次活动，但由于有报道称寻求与习近平擦肩而过的企业票价高昂，此次活动引发了争议。

Mike Gallagher, the Republican chairman of the U.S. House of Representatives' select committee on China, had called it "unconscionable" that U.S. companies would pay thousands of dollars to join a dinner with a government the United States says is committing genocide against Muslim Uyghurs.翻译:美国众议院中国问题特别委员会共和党主席迈克·加拉格尔(Mike Gallagher)称，美国公司愿意支付数千美元与美国称正在对穆斯林维吾尔人实施种族灭绝的政府共进晚餐，这是“不合理的”。

Gallagher sent a letter on Monday to the hosts – the U.S.-China Business Council and the National Committee on U.S.-China Relations – demanding a complete list of individuals and companies that purchased tickets to the dinner.翻译:加拉格尔周一致函东道主美中贸易全国委员会和美中关系全国委员会，要求提供购买晚宴门票的个人和公司的完整名单。

Analysts have said Xi's speech alone is unlikely to dramatically alter U.S. business sentiment about China.翻译:分析人士表示，仅习近平的讲话不太可能大幅改变美国企业对中国的信心。

U.S. and Chinese officials have often described bilateral business and trade relations as the ballast in otherwise contentious ties with the U.S. But the growing economic and geopolitical rivalry between the superpowers has placed companies from both countries in the crosshairs of the other's government.翻译:美国和中国官员经常将双边商业和贸易关系描述为中美其他有争议关系的压舱石。但这两个超级大国之间日益激烈的经济和地缘政治竞争使两国企业成为对方政府的攻击目标。

China has grown more suspicious of engagement with Western companies, in line with Xi's emphasis on self-reliance and national security, and this year it has cracked down on some U.S. consultancy and due-diligence firms, further damaging investor confidence.翻译:随着习近平强调自力更生和国家安全，中国对与西方公司的接触变得更加怀疑，今年中国还打压了一些美国咨询和尽职调查公司，进一步损害了投资者的信心。

But Gary Dvorchak, whose family hosted Xi in Iowa in 1985 as a young Chinese official, and who was invited by Beijing to attend the dinner, said Xi's appearance was savvy public relations, allowing the ruling Communist Party to show his appeal to regular people.翻译:但加里·德沃尔查克(Gary Dvorchak)表示，习近平的出现是精明的公共关系，让执政的共产党向普通民众展示了他的吸引力。1985年，习近平还是一名年轻的中国官员，他的家人在爱荷华州接待了习近平，他还应北京邀请参加了晚宴。

"It humanizes him and it gives him an ability to show a connection to the American people and bypass the American media," Dvorchak said.翻译:德沃查克说：“这使他变得人性化，让他有能力绕过美国媒体，表现出与美国人民的联系。”

Reporting by Michael Martina, Valerie Insinna, Stephen Nellis, Lisa Baertlein, Niket Nishant; Aditional reporting by Ethan Wang and Liz Lee in Beijing; Editing by Stephen Coates and Josie Kao翻译:Michael Martina、Valerie Insinna、Stephen Nellis、Lisa Baertlein、Niket Nishant 报道； Ethan Wang 和 Liz Lee 在北京的补充报道；斯蒂芬·科茨和乔西·高编辑

item.title: 欧盟冯德莱恩：中国峰会旨在实现公平竞争环境
item.description:
European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said on Thursday that a key goal of the EU summit with China in Beijing in December was to achieve a level playing field in trade in light of market distortions.翻译:欧盟委员会主席乌尔苏拉·冯德莱恩周四表示，12月在北京举行的欧盟与中国峰会的一个关键目标是在市场扭曲的情况下实现公平的贸易竞争环境。

As one example, von der Leyen said Chinese overcapacity in the clean tech sector was set to worsen and be exported as its economy slowed down, worsening distortions in the EU market - which the bloc could not accept.翻译:冯德莱恩举例说，随着经济放缓，中国清洁技术领域的产能过剩将进一步恶化并出口，从而加剧欧盟市场的扭曲——这是欧盟无法接受的。

China's trade surplus with the EU was the highest in history last year, just below 400 billion euros ($434.96 billion), she said.翻译:她表示，去年中国对欧盟的贸易顺差创历史最高水平，略低于4000亿欧元（4349.6亿美元）。

"We do not accept distortion from the inside, we should not accept it from the outside either," she told a conference on China in Berlin, noting this was why the EU had launched an investigation into imports of Chinese electric vehicles.翻译:她在柏林举行的中国问题会议上表示：“我们不接受来自内部的扭曲，我们也不应该接受来自外部的扭曲。”她指出，这就是欧盟对中国电动汽车进口发起调查的原因。

"Europe is open for competition. Not for a race to the bottom."翻译:“欧洲对竞争持开放态度。而不是逐底竞争。”

Von der Leyen said, however, that as much as the EU would protect its interests, it would also seek to address disagreements with China through dialogue - for example at their Dec. 7-8 summit, which comes after U.S. President Joe Biden met this week with Chinese President Xi Jinping.翻译:不过，冯德莱恩表示，欧盟在保护自身利益的同时，也将寻求通过对话解决与中国的分歧，例如在美国总统乔·拜登会见特朗普之后举行的 12 月 7 日至 8 日峰会上。与中国国家主席习近平的一周。

"Our goal is to achieve a level playing field in our trade relationship with China," said the official, who has driven recent European efforts to "de-risk" from Asia's rising superpower.翻译:这位官员表示：“我们的目标是在与中国的贸易关系中实现公平的竞争环境。”他最近推动欧洲努力“降低”来自亚洲崛起超级大国的风险。

"We will go to China in good faith," said von der Leyen. "We will never be shy in raising our concerns. But we must leave space for a discussion on a more ambitious relationship that benefits both of sides."翻译:冯德莱恩表示：“我们将真诚地前往中国。” “我们永远不会羞于提出我们的担忧。但我们必须留出空间，讨论建立更雄心勃勃、对双方都有利的关系。”

Von der Leyen said she expected action from China to deal with the current imbalances.翻译:冯德莱恩表示，她预计中国将采取行动解决当前的失衡问题。

"The story of how we relate to China is not yet fully written. Nothing is predetermined, we have agency and China is capable of change."翻译:“我们与中国的关系还没有完全写好。没有什么是预先确定的，我们有代理权，中国有能力改变。”

($1 = 0.9196 euros)翻译:（1 美元 = 0.9196 欧元）

item.title: 菲律宾拒绝中国关于在争议海域执行补给任务事先通知的要求
item.description:
The Philippines does not have to give China prior notice about resupply missions in its own territory in the South China Sea, saying the operations, including the "upkeep" of a grounded navy ship, are legitimate, its foreign ministry said on Thursday.翻译:菲律宾外交部周四表示，菲律宾不必就在其南海领土上执行补给任务事先通知中国，并称这些行动，包括“维护”一艘搁浅的海军舰艇，都是合法的。

The Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) also called on China to remove all "illegal structures" it built within the Philippines' exclusive economic zone (EEZ), cease reclamation in those areas and be accountable for the damage the activities caused.翻译:外交部还呼吁中国拆除在菲律宾专属经济区（EEZ）内建造的所有“非法建筑”，停止在这些地区进行填海造地活动，并对这些活动造成的损害承担责任。

China has repeatedly accused the Philippines of illegally entering its waters without its permission during its missions to transport food and water to Filipino soldiers living aboard a navy ship that Manila grounded at the disputed Second Thomas Shoal. The atoll is called Ayungin by the Philippines and Renai Reef by China.翻译:中国一再指责菲律宾在执行向菲律宾搁浅在有争议的仁爱礁的一艘海军舰艇上的菲律宾士兵运送食物和水的任务期间，未经中国允许非法进入其水域。该环礁被菲律宾称为阿云金，中国被称为仁爱礁。

"We are being asked to give prior notification each time we conduct a resupply mission to Ayungin Shoal. We will not do so," DFA spokesperson Teresita Daza said in a statement.翻译:外交部发言人特雷西塔·达扎（Teresita Daza）在一份声明中表示：“每次前往阿云金浅滩执行补给任务时，我们都被要求提前通知。我们不会这样做。”

China claims sovereignty over nearly the entire South China Sea, pointing to a line on its maps that cuts into the EEZs of Vietnam, the Philippines, Malaysia, Brunei and Indonesia. Taiwan, which China also claims as part of its territory, has said it does not accept Beijing's maps.翻译:中国声称对几乎整个南海拥有主权，并指出其地图上有一条线切入了越南、菲律宾、马来西亚、文莱和印度尼西亚的专属经济区。中国也声称台湾是其领土的一部分，台湾已表示不接受北京的地图。

The Permanent Court of Arbitration in 2016 said the line on China's maps had no legal basis, which Beijing rejects.翻译:2016年，常设仲裁法院表示，中国地图上的这条线没有法律依据，但北京方面对此予以否认。

U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin reiterated his support for the court ruling during a meeting with his Manila counterpart in Jakarta. Both have denounced harassment by China towards Philippine vessels conducting the resupply mission.翻译:美国国防部长劳埃德·奥斯汀在雅加达与马尼拉国防部长会面时重申了对法院裁决的支持。两人都谴责中国骚扰执行补给任务的菲律宾船只。

A spokesperson for the Philippines National Security Council on Thursday flagged a disinformation campaign by "propagandists" and "information operators" that aims to undermine U.S.-Philippines relations and sway public opinion in China's favour.翻译:菲律宾国家安全委员会发言人周四指出，“宣传者”和“信息操纵者”发起虚假信息活动，旨在破坏美菲关系并影响公众舆论，使之有利于中国。

The narratives include portraying "the relationship between the U.S. and the Philippines as superior-inferior relationship," said Jonathan Malaya.翻译:乔纳森·马来亚说，这些叙述包括将“美国和菲律宾之间的关系描述为上下关系”。

"It just so happened that in this particular dispute the interests of the United States and the Philippines aligned," Malaya told reporters. "We are cognizant of the fact that there will be a time that the interests of the Philippines and the U.S. will diverge."翻译:马来亚告诉记者：“碰巧的是，在这一特殊争端中，美国和菲律宾的利益是一致的。” “我们认识到，菲律宾和美国的利益终有一天会出现分歧。”

Since the grounding of the Sierra Madre ship at the atoll in 1999 in Manila's attempt to assert its sovereignty claim, China has repeatedly called on the Philippines to tow the vessel away, based on an agreement which Manila says does not exist.翻译:自1999年马尼拉试图主张其主权主张而导致马德雷山脉船只在环礁搁浅以来，中国一再呼吁菲律宾根据马尼拉称不存在的协议拖走该船。

"The Philippines has not entered into any agreement abandoning its sovereign rights and jurisdiction over its EEZ and continental shelf, including in the vicinity of Ayungin Shoal," Daza said.翻译:达扎说：“菲律宾尚未签署任何放弃其专属经济区和大陆架主权权利和管辖权的协议，包括阿云金浅滩附近的地区。”

The Second Thomas Shoal lies 190 km (118 miles) off the Philippine island of Palawan, well within the Manila's EEZ.翻译:仁爱礁距离菲律宾巴拉望岛 190 公里（118 英里），位于马尼拉专属经济区内。

China's embassy in Manila did not immediately respond to a request for comment.翻译:中国驻马尼拉大使馆没有立即回应置评请求。

item.title: 惠誉：工行美国子公司遭受的网络攻击不会对母行产生重大影响
item.description:
Ratings agency Fitch on Thursday said the recent cyberattack at ICBC Financial Services will not have a material impact on its Chinese parent, although it highlights growing threats to global payment networks from such incidents.翻译:评级机构惠誉周四表示，工银金融服务公司最近遭受的网络攻击不会对其中国母公司产生重大影响，尽管这突显出此类事件对全球支付网络的威胁越来越大。

The U.S. arm of Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Ltd (ICBC) was hit by a ransomware attack last week that disrupted trades and sent ripples through the U.S. Treasuries market, where the bank acts as a broker for hedge funds and other market participants.翻译:中国工商银行（ICBC）美国分行上周遭受勒索软件攻击，导致交易中断，并在美国国债市场引发连锁反应，该行充当对冲基金和其他市场参与者的经纪人。

"We do not expect the incident to have any immediate impact on the parent bank's viability rating, nor will the bank's issuer default rating change as it remains driven by our expectation of support from the Chinese sovereign," the ratings firm said.翻译:该评级公司表示：“我们预计该事件不会对母行的生存能力评级产生任何直接影响，该行的发行人违约评级也不会发生变化，因为它仍然受到我们对中国主权支持的预期的推动。”

The U.S. unit primarily engages in providing global clearing, execution and financing services to institutional clients.翻译:美国部门主要为机构客户提供全球清算、执行和融资服务。

item.title: 中国的宣传框架习近平的美国转向
item.description:
What a difference eight months makes: In March, shortly after the U.S. shot down a suspected Chinese surveillance balloon, President Xi Jinping blamed it for challenges faced by China's economy, complaining of "all-round containment".翻译:八个月的变化有多大：3月份，在美国击落一个疑似中国监视气球后不久，习近平主席将中国经济面临的挑战归咎于美国，抱怨“全方位遏制”。

Then on Wednesday, U.S. President Joe Biden and Xi agreed to open a presidential hotline, resume military-to-military communications and work to curb fentanyl production, showing tangible progress in their first face-to-face talks in a year at a summit in California.翻译:随后在周三，美国总统乔·拜登和习近平同意开通总统热线，恢复军方间的沟通，并努力遏制芬太尼生产，这在他们一年来在峰会上首次面对面会谈中取得了切实进展。加利福尼亚州。

While key issues like U.S. sanctions on chip exports remain unresolved, Chinese state media is now striking a different tone, focusing on Xi's smile during past trips to Iowa, fireside chats with its residents, and sharing chocolates with Biden.翻译:尽管美国对芯片出口的制裁等关键问题仍未解决，但中国官方媒体现在却采取了不同的语气，重点关注习近平过去访问爱荷华州时的微笑、与居民的炉边谈话以及与拜登分享巧克力。

Clips from the summit on China's social media show the two leaders walking in gardens at the site of the talks, and chatting by Xi's official limousine, with discussion of U.S. tech curbs and tension over Taiwan featuring less prominently.翻译:中国社交媒体上的峰会片段显示，两位领导人在会谈现场的花园中散步，并在习近平的官方豪华轿车上聊天，而有关美国科技限制和台湾紧张局势的讨论则不那么突出。

The Chinese rhetoric seeks to show Xi to a domestic audience as Biden's equal and highlights his desire to stabilise ties as China grapples with a moribund economy, analysts say. It also sends a signal of approval to the bureaucracy and businesses on engaging with Americans.翻译:分析人士称，中国的言论旨在向国内观众展示习近平与拜登的平等地位，并强调他在中国应对垂死的经济之际稳定关系的愿望。它还向官僚机构和企业发出了批准与美国人接触的信号。

"It reflects a very strong desire on the part of Chinese leaders to stabilise relations with the U.S. and push for more cooperation," said Li Mingjiang, international relations scholar at the Rajaratnam School of International Studies in Singapore.翻译:新加坡拉惹勒南国际关系学院国际关系学者李明江表示：“这反映了中国领导人稳定与美国关系、推动更多合作的强烈愿望。”

"There's this fundamental message in the Chinese narrative that the Chinese leader is capable of managing China-U.S. relations ... he is the one who gives instructions to the U.S. and the American leadership on how to manage the bilateral ties."翻译:“中国的叙述中有一个基本信息，那就是中国领导人有能力管理中美关系……他是向美国和美国领导人指示如何管理双边关系的人。”

China's domestic propaganda machine worked overtime to pave the way for Xi's pivot, also evident at a dinner with U.S. executives, when he pledged that China was ready to be a "partner and friend" of the U.S. and there was "plenty of room for bilateral cooperation".翻译:中国的国内宣传机器加班加点地为习近平的转向铺平道路，这一点在与美国高管的一次晚宴上也可见一斑，当时他承诺中国已准备好成为美国的“伙伴和朋友”，并且“双边关系有足够的空间”。合作”。

With official ties still strained, Chinese state media has focused on relations between the people and emphasised the potential for cooperation and importance of the summit for the Asia-Pacific region.翻译:在官方关系仍然紧张的情况下，中国官方媒体将重点放在人民之间的关系上，并强调了亚太地区合作的潜力和峰会的重要性。

"The international community watches with bated breath, recognising the weight of this meeting," the state news agency Xinhua said in an editorial. "When China-U.S. relations are good, the region benefits; when relations sour, the region suffers."

'AMERICAN FRIENDS'

Xinhua also ran a 1,500-word report reminiscing about Xi's past visits to the U.S..翻译:新华社还发表了1500字的报道，回忆习近平历次访美经历。

"Xi never forgets his American friends and believes that people hold the key to state-to-state relations," the news agency said.翻译:该通讯社称：“习近平永远不会忘记他的美国朋友，并相信国家关系的关键在于人民。”

The report cited Iowans who helped coordinate a 1985 trip Xi made to the state as a young official, describing his "smile that would not stop", and lauding his curiosity. It also described Biden and Xi sampling chocolates from a box during a past exchange.翻译:报告援引爱荷华州人的话说，他们曾帮助协调习近平 1985 年作为一名年轻官员访问该州，描述了他的“笑容不会停止”，并赞扬了他的好奇心。它还描述了拜登和习近平在过去的一次交流中从盒子里品尝巧克力的情况。

Gary Dvorchak, an Iowan considered by Xi an old friend of China, said Xi's fondness for Iowa was genuine but that the Chinese leader also used his ties to the state for propaganda value.翻译:被习近平视为中国老朋友的爱荷华州人加里·德沃尔恰克(Gary Dvorchak)表示，习近平对爱荷华州的喜爱是真诚的，但中国领导人也利用他与该州的关系来达到宣传目的。

“It humanises him and it gives him an ability to show a connection to the American people and bypass the American media,” said Dvorchak.翻译:德沃查克说：“这让他变得人性化，让他能够绕过美国媒体，展现出与美国人民的联系。”

“They use it when they need to bolster his support domestically or internationally,” said Dvorchak, who said he thought it was canny public relations.翻译:德沃查克说：“当他们需要在国内或国际上支持他时，他们就会使用它。”他说，他认为这是精明的公共关系。

“Part of the reason it works is because those feelings are real.”翻译:“它之所以有效，部分原因是因为这些感觉是真实的。”

But even on censored Chinese social media users found ways to make critical comments on the tone of the official commentary.翻译:但即使是在受到审查的中国社交媒体上，用户也找到了对官方评论语气发表批评性评论的方法。

"Where did the relations improve? Tariffs, chips, studying overseas, none of these are mentioned."翻译:“关系改善在哪里？关税、芯片、留学，这些都没有提到。”

On the Weibo Chinese microblogging site, the most popular hashtag on Thursday still harked back to tension over Taiwan: "China must be and will be reunified."翻译:在中国的微博网站微博上，周四最受欢迎的话题标签仍然让人回想起台湾的紧张局势：“中国必须而且将会统一。”

Additional reporting by Albee Zhang and Beijing newsroom, Michael Martina in Washington and Greg Torode in Hong Kong; editing by Robert Birsel翻译:Albee 张和北京新闻编辑部、华盛顿的 Michael Martina 和香港的 Greg Torode 进行了补充报道；罗伯特·伯塞尔编辑

item.title: 中国不那么特别的经济区体现了严峻的新现实
item.description:
Tony Xiong is among the latest arrivals to the glitzy office towers in the newest part of Shenzhen, built to showcase China's economic miracle. He won't spend any personal time in the area.翻译:熊托尼 (Tony Xiong) 是最新一批来到深圳最新城区的豪华办公楼的人之一，这些办公楼是为了展示中国的经济奇迹而建造的。他不会在该地区度过任何私人时间。

Most lunch breaks, he drives 20 to 30 minutes to more-established parts of Shenzhen to slurp beef noodles in family-owned restaurants before racing back to work.翻译:大多数午休时间，他都会开车 20 到 30 分钟前往深圳较成熟的地区，在家庭经营的餐馆里吃牛肉面，然后再赶回去工作。

"In Qianhai, it's either a 10-minute walk in the sun to the mall or the terrible cafeteria food," said the 30-year-old, a finance worker in a state-owned property firm. "I don't like being there."翻译:“在前海，要么是在阳光下步行10分钟才能到达商场，要么是食堂的食物很糟糕，”这位30岁的国有地产公司财务人员说。 “我不喜欢呆在那里。”

Office workers are not the only ones grumbling about the unattractiveness of Qianhai, a special economic zone where Chinese dreams of global financial might and economic prosperity that once seemed inevitable are now darkened by half-empty skyscrapers and shopping malls as well as barely used motorways.翻译:抱怨前海缺乏吸引力的不只是上班族。前海是一个经济特区，中国人曾经看似不可避免的全球金融实力和经济繁荣的梦想现在却被半空的摩天大楼、购物中心和几乎不使用的高速公路所蒙蔽。

This Shenzhen appendix opened for business more than a decade ago after an initial investment of $45 billion, with state media calling it mainland China's own Hong Kong: a future international tech and finance hub; a testbed for liberalising markets and information access.翻译:这家位于深圳的附属机构在初始投资 450 亿美元后于十多年前开业，官方媒体称其为中国大陆的香港：未来的国际科技和金融中心；市场和信息准入自由化的试验台。

But Reuters interviews with 10 executives and investors, as well as real estate experts, diplomats and economists and 10 workers in the area during six visits between September and November paint a picture of a largely deserted district that has given up on its reformist ambitions. At the same time, these people said, Qianhai is struggling to stand out among 2,500 other special zones across China dangling various subsidies at reluctant businesses.翻译:但路透社在 9 月至 11 月期间的六次访问中对该地区的 10 名高管和投资者、房地产专家、外交官和经济学家以及 10 名工人进行了采访，描绘了一幅基本上荒芜的地区的图景，该地区已经放弃了改革的雄心。与此同时，这些人士表示，前海正努力在中国其他 2,500 个特区中脱颖而出，向不情愿的企业提供各种补贴。

Five economists and three diplomats told Reuters Qianhai's travails reflect the limits of China's old "build it and they will come" growth model - one that worked wonders a generation earlier for wider Shenzhen, among the country's first and most successful special economic zones.翻译:五名经济学家和三名外交官告诉路透社，前海的困境反映了中国旧有的“建好后就会来” 增长模式的局限性，这种模式在上一代人的身上为深圳创造了奇迹，深圳是中国第一个也是最成功的经济特区之一。

The office vacancy rate was 28.9% in the third quarter, near the highest in three years, versus 23.2% in Shenzhen overall, and 15.1% to 17.1% in Beijing and Shanghai, according to Knight Frank, despite Qianhai's lower rental prices.翻译:莱坊的数据显示，尽管前海租金价格较低，但第三季度写字楼空置率为28.9%，接近三年来最高水平，而深圳整体空置率为23.2%，北京和上海空置率为15.1%至17.1%。

And that's before China's tallest skyscraper of over 1,000 metres and a cluster of other towers are completed. The relentless supply has driven up vacancies, but newcomers other than state-connected firms are hard to find, three real estate executives told Reuters on the condition of anonymity due to the subject's sensitivity.翻译:而这还是在中国最高的 1000 米以上摩天大楼和其他塔楼竣工之前。三名房地产高管对路透表示，源源不断的供应推高了空置率，但除了国有企业之外，很难找到新来者。由于该话题的敏感性，他们要求匿名。

With China entering a new era of sluggish growth, Qianhai may never reach the international status to which it aspires.翻译:随着中国进入增长低迷的新时代，前海可能永远无法达到它所渴望的国际地位。

Analysts say Qianhai, and China, need to resume the market overhauls Beijing intended to pilot in the special area more than a decade ago, while the economy as a whole needs to rely more on household consumption for high growth to resume.翻译:分析人士表示，前海和中国需要恢复十多年前北京打算在该特区试点的市场改革，而整体经济需要更多地依靠居民消费来恢复高增长。

"When a country reaches the state of development of China today, one cannot grow from special zones," said Antonio Fatas, a professor of economics at INSEAD international business school. "Growth is much more complex, it requires reforms that are comprehensive."翻译:欧洲工商管理学院(INSEAD)国际商学院经济学教授安东尼奥·法塔斯(Antonio Fatas)表示：“当一个国家达到中国今天的发展水平时，就无法从特区中发展起来。” “增长要复杂得多，它需要全面的改革。”

The Qianhai Authority and China's State Council Information Office did not respond to Reuters requests for comment on the local and macro economic challenges.

UNFULFILLED PROMISES

In the past four decades, Shenzhen grew from a collection of villages into a megacity of 18 million people, home to some of China's biggest firms.翻译:在过去的四十年里，深圳从一个由村庄组成的城市发展成为拥有 1800 万人口的大城市，是中国一些最大的公司的所在地。

It became the runaway success story of former Chinese leader Deng Xiaoping's "reform and opening up" policies, with its business friendliness since replicated by other cities, especially along the Pearl River Delta, in tandem with an unparalleled infrastructure build-up.翻译:它成为中国前领导人邓小平“改革开放”政策的巨大成功故事，其商业友好性后来被其他城市，特别是珠三角沿线城市效仿，同时还有无与伦比的基础设施建设。

In 2010, Beijing approved the Qianhai project as a policy laboratory to jumpstart a new growth stage for China.翻译:2010年，北京批准前海项目作为政策实验室，以推动中国进入新的增长阶段。

Plans included a Hong Kong-like independent antigraft body, a pilot to pioneer the gradual opening of the country's capital account and internationalising the yuan; and full internet freedom throughout the area.翻译:计划包括建立一个类似香港的独立反腐败机构、率先逐步开放国家资本账户和人民币国际化的试点；整个地区享有完全的互联网自由。

When President Xi Jinping visited Qianhai on his first trip as general secretary of the Communist Party in 2012, predicting it would be "more special than a special zone," those changes seemed just the beginning of a more open China.翻译:2012年，当习近平主席以中共总书记的身份第一次访问前海时，他预测前海将“比特区更特别”，这些变化似乎只是一个更加开放的中国的开始。

But the plans were scrapped one by one over the following years.翻译:但这些计划在接下来的几年里被一一取消。

By the time Xi returned for the 40th anniversary of Deng's changes in 2019, the mood had soured, as state supervision over markets tightened, the capital account was largely sealed after an outflows scare in 2015, and censorship and surveillance intensified.翻译:2019年，当习近平回来参加邓小平改革40周年纪念日时，随着国家对市场的监管收紧，资本账户在2015年的资本外流恐慌后基本被封锁，审查和监视力度加大，人们的情绪已经恶化。

"The last 10 years have not been about real reforms and open doors," said Zhiwu Chen, professor of finance at the University of Hong Kong. "Instead, reversals of past reforms have carried the day," he said, adding this has stifled Qianhai's progress.翻译:香港大学金融学教授陈志武表示：“过去十年并没有真正的改革和开放。” “相反，过去改革的逆转已经取得了胜利，”他说，并补充说这抑制了前海的进步。

"In the old days, officials in Qianhai would have been encouraged and incentivised to experiment with creative policy innovations. In the current political environment, officials put much higher priority on minimising risk."

LOW TAXES, SUBSIDIES

Without the promised changes, Qianhai's remaining selling points are income taxes of 15%, versus 25% in most of China, its proximity to Hong Kong, and some of the country's newest office and commercial facilities, which come with a one-off 30 million yuan ($4.1 million) subsidy for purchases and up to 5 million yuan yearly for rents.翻译:如果没有承诺的改变，前海剩下的卖点是 15% 的所得税（而中国大部分地区为 25%）、毗邻香港，以及中国一些最新的办公和商业设施，一次性价值 3000 万美元。人民币（410万美元）的购房补贴和每年高达500万元的租金补贴。

Qianhai Authority, which runs the area, says more than 100,000 companies have set up shop in the area, including HSBC, UBS and Standard Chartered.翻译:管理该地区的前海管理局表示，已有超过 10 万家公司在该地区设立分支机构，其中包括汇丰银行、瑞银集团和渣打银行。

The zone has attracted family offices, venture capital and private equity funds, said Witman Hung, delegate to China's parliament and formerly the authority's principal liaison officer for Hong Kong.翻译:中国人大代表、前人大驻香港首席联络官洪为民表示，该特区吸引了家族办公室、风险投资和私募股权基金。

But property agents, executives and investors say many firms that registered in Qianhai never physically moved there.翻译:但房地产经纪人、高管和投资者表示，许多在前海注册的公司从未实际搬到那里。

"We don't actually have any people there, I've never even gone to the address," said Brian Miller, who owns a warehouse business elsewhere in Shenzhen but registered in Qianhai on his accountant's advice.翻译:“我们那里实际上没有任何人，我什至从来没有去过那个地址，”布莱恩·米勒(Brian Miller)说。他在深圳其他地方拥有一家仓库业务，但根据会计师的建议在前海注册了。

A tech executive who spoke on the condition of anonymity because of the topic's sensitivity said his firm rents in Qianhai for tax reasons and to maintain good government relations. He had planned to expand operations there but changed his mind as the economy slowed. He now keeps a skeleton crew.翻译:一位因话题敏感而不愿透露姓名的科技高管表示，他的公司在前海出租是出于税收原因，也是为了维持良好的政府关系。他原本计划在那里扩大业务，但随着经济放缓而改变了主意。他现在拥有一支骨干人员队伍。

"It's not a Qianhai problem, it's a macroeconomic problem," he said.

ZONED OUT

Another drawback is that Qianhai's incentives are similar to what other special zones offer, including those nearby such as Nansha near Guangzhou and Hengqin next to Macau. But Qianhai rents are double those in Hengqin and sixfold those in Nansha, agents say.翻译:另一个缺点是，前海的激励措施与其他特区相似，包括广州附近的南沙和澳门旁边的横琴等附近的特区。但中介称，前海的租金是横琴的两倍，是南沙的六倍。

"Before, every area had a little speciality to follow but now anywhere can do everything, it's too confusing," said Klaus Zenkel, who chairs the European Chamber of Commerce in South China, adding no new European companies were moving in.翻译:华南欧盟商会主席克劳斯·曾克尔表示：“以前，每个地区都有一点专业需要遵循，但现在任何地方都可以做任何事情，这太混乱了。”他补充说，没有新的欧洲公司入驻。

"The infrastructure is there, it's just - how do you convince companies to come?"翻译:“基础设施已经有了，只是——你如何说服公司来？”

A chamber survey of 75 companies in June found only 44% were optimistic about the Greater Bay Area, another name for the cluster of southern Chinese cities, down from 68% in 2022.翻译:商会 6 月份对 75 家企业进行的调查发现，只有 44% 的企业对大湾区（中国南方城市群的别称）持乐观态度，低于 2022 年的 68%。

Bill Deng, CEO of cross-border finance firm XTransfer, says he won't move to Qianhai.翻译:跨境金融公司XTransfer的首席执行官比尔·邓(Bill Deng)表示，他不会搬到前海。

Hong Kong "has a global system that's free, they have the talent, they have the experience," he said, adding the mainland has been "very cautious" about financial opening.翻译:他说，香港“拥有自由的全球体系，他们有人才、有经验”，并补充说内地对金融开放一直“非常谨慎”。

On Qianhai's streets, some people are enjoying the serenity. A driving instructor finds the area perfect for first lessons. A shop assistant levels up on a smartphone game.翻译:前海的街道上，一些人正在享受这份宁静。驾驶教练发现这里非常适合上第一堂课。一名店员通过智能手机游戏升级。

At a cafe close to a rock inscribed with Deng's calligraphy of Qianhai, a barista who only gave his surname, Zhang, spends most of his time chatting with other staff.翻译:在刻有邓小平前海题字的岩石旁的一家咖啡馆里，一位只透露自己姓张的咖啡师大部分时间都在和其他工作人员聊天。

"There aren't many customers and I don't think lots of people visit for the rock. Sometimes I'm bored, but quiet is good," he said.翻译:“顾客不多，我认为没有多少人来参观这块岩石。有时我很无聊，但安静很好，”他说。

item.title: 深圳世茂土地法院拍卖再次失败
item.description:
A court auction to sell vast commercial land plots owned by defaulted Shimao Group (0813.HK) in Shenzhen failed for a second time on Thursday as there were no bidders, highlighting weak demand in China's property market.翻译:周四，深圳法院拍卖了违约的世茂集团（0813.HK）拥有的大量商业用地，由于没有投标人，第二次拍卖失败，凸显了中国房地产市场的需求疲软。

Twelve land plots totalling 243,602 square metres, together with some uncompleted buildings on them, have asked for 10.4 billion yuan ($1.4 billion), 20% lower than the 13 billion yuan starting price in the first auction in July, according to e-commerce company JD.com's (9618.HK) online auction platform.翻译:据电子商务公司称，总面积为 243,602 平方米的 12 块地块及其上的一些未完工建筑的标价为 104 亿元人民币（14 亿美元），比 7 月份首次拍卖的 130 亿元人民币起拍价低 20%京东（9618.HK）的在线拍卖平台。

China's property sector, which has seen many company defaults since it slipped into a debt crisis in mid-2021, is struggling to stabilise due to a bleak economic outlook.翻译:自2021年年中陷入债务危机以来，中国房地产行业已出现许多公司违约，由于经济前景黯淡，该行业正难以企稳。

The Shenzhen plots were part of the land parcel bought by Shanghai-based Shimao in 2017, which planned to build a new landmark complex in China's tech hub with the city's tallest skyscraper.翻译:深圳地块是上海世茂集团于2017年购买的地块的一部分，世茂集团计划在中国科技中心建设一座新的地标综合体，拥有该市最高的摩天大楼。

Many of the assets of Shimao, which defaulted its $11.8 billion of offshore debt last July, were being sold to raise funds or were seized by creditors.翻译:世茂去年7月拖欠了118亿美元的离岸债务，其许多资产被出售以筹集资金或被债权人扣押。

Media reports said the land plots, valued at 16.3 billion yuan, were the most valuable assets being auctioned by Chinese courts in seven years.翻译:媒体报道称，这些地块价值163亿元人民币，是中国法院七年来拍卖的最有价值的资产。

China's government land sales revenue and property sales both fell at a faster pace in October, down 25.4% and 20.33% respectively from a year earlier, official data showed this week, suggesting the crisis-hit sector is yet to emerge from its decline despite Beijing's support efforts.翻译:官方数据本周显示，10 月份中国政府土地出让收入和房地产销售双双下降，同比分别下降 25.4% 和 20.33%，这表明尽管北京方面支持努力。

Authorities have been ramping up measures to support real estate, including relaxing home purchase restrictions and lowering borrowing costs.翻译:当局一直在加大力度支持房地产，包括放宽购房限制和降低借贷成本。

($1 = 7.2594 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2594 人民币）

item.title: 中国房价连续四个月下跌 或进一步走弱
item.description:
Summary:
  • Prices fall for fourth month in monthly and annual terms
  • More cities record monthly price decline
翻译:概括：
  • 月度和年度价格连续第四个月下跌
  • 更多城市房价月度下跌

China's new home prices fell for the fourth straight month with dozens of cities hit by declines, the most since the peak of the COVID-19 pandemic last year, suggesting a broader weakening in the sector that could drag on the country's overall recovery.翻译:中国的新房价格连续第四个月下跌，数十个城市出现跌幅，这是自去年COVID-19大流行高峰以来的最大跌幅，表明该行业更广泛的疲软可能会拖累该国的整体复苏。

New home prices in October dropped 0.3% month-on-month after a 0.2% dip in September, according to Reuters calculations based on National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) data.翻译:路透社根据国家统计局数据计算，继9月份下降0.2%之后，10月份新建住宅价格环比下降0.3%。

Once a key engine of economic growth accounting for around a quarter of China's economic activity, a regulatory crackdown since 2020 to curb debt has tightened liquidity and raised default risks for developers, delaying many projects.翻译:曾经是经济增长的关键引擎，约占中国经济活动的四分之一，但自2020年以来为遏制债务而实施的监管打压导致流动性收紧，并增加了开发商的违约风险，导致许多项目被推迟。

Authorities have rolled out a flurry of measures to prop up the pivotal sector, including relaxing curbs on home purchases and cutting borrowing costs but homebuyers remain cautious.翻译:当局推出了一系列措施来支撑这一关键行业，包括放宽购房限制和降低借贷成本，但购房者仍保持谨慎态度。

"The most important reason for the bearish home prices is that demand is weak, buyers don't know if pre-sold homes they buy will be delivered on the dates promised by the developers," said Ma Hong, senior analyst at Zhixin Investment Research Institute.翻译:执信投研高级分析师马洪表示，“房价看跌最重要的原因是需求疲软，买家不知道自己购买的预售房能否按开发商承诺的日期交付”。研究所。

Nomura estimated there are around 20 million pre-sold units that are either not yet constructed or delayed. That is equivalent to 20 times the number of unfinished projects by indebted developer Country Garden (2007.HK) as of end-2022.翻译:野村证券估计，约有 2000 万套预售单位尚未建成或已延迟。这相当于负债开发商碧桂园（2007.HK）截至2022年底未完工项目数量的20倍。

Bearish home prices follow data on Wednesday showing some improvement in industrial output and retail sales, which both beat expectations in October, but overall investment growth was tepid and property sales and investment slumped sharply.翻译:周三公布的数据显示，10 月份工业产出和零售销售有所改善，均超出预期，但整体投资增长不温不火，房地产销售和投资大幅下滑，导致房价下跌。

"Residents remain uncertain about income growth, and there are poor returns on financial investments in the country. They are hesitant to buy a big-ticket item like a house," Ma added.翻译:马云补充道：“居民收入增长仍存在不确定性，国内金融投资回报率较低。他们对购买房子等大件物品犹豫不决。”

Out of 70 cities, 56 reported declines in monthly prices last month, marking the most cities number since October 2020, up from 54 in September.

TWIST AND TURNS

House prices in three major cities Beijing, Shenzhen and Guangzhou all fell month-on-month in October.翻译:10月份北京、深圳、广州三大城市房价环比均下跌。

Compared with a year earlier, nationwide prices were down 0.1%, matching a decline in September, August and July.翻译:与去年同期相比，全国价格下降0.1%，与9月、8月和7月的降幅一致。

For existing home, NBS data showed 67 cities posted month-on-month price declines in October, up from 65 in September.翻译:就现房而言，国家统计局数据显示，10 月份有 67 个城市价格环比下降，高于 9 月份的 65 个。

The property market is still in adjustment and transformation, and there will be "twists and turns" in the economic recovery, Liu Aihua, spokesperson for the National Bureau of Statistics, said on Wednesday.翻译:国家统计局新闻发言人刘爱华周三表示，房地产市场仍处于调整转型之中，经济复苏将出现“波折”。

Despite the lifting of strict COVID measures late last year and a slew of support measures, the world's second-biggest economy has struggled to get back on solid footing, largely due to weak consumer confidence and the deepening property crisis.翻译:尽管去年年底取消了严格的新冠疫情措施并采取了一系列支持措施，但世界第二大经济体仍难以恢复稳固的基础，这主要是由于消费者信心疲软和房地产危机不断加深。

"House prices are expected to continue to fall in the traditionally low season of November and December," said Zhang Dawei, analyst at property agency Centaline.翻译:中原地产分析师张大伟表示：“预计11月和12月的传统淡季房价将继续下跌。”

Zhang said property policies, especially in the first-tier cities, need to be stepped up.翻译:张说，房地产政策，特别是一线城市的房地产政策，需要加强。

China's central bank plans to provide at least $137 billion of low cost financing to the country's urban village renovation and affordable housing programmes.翻译:中国央行计划为城中村改造和保障性住房项目提供至少1370亿美元的低成本融资。

Reporting by Liangping Gao, Ella Cao and Ryan Woo; Editing by Jacqueline Wong翻译:高亮平、曹艾拉、吴瑞安报道；编辑：黄杰奎琳

item.title: 习近平告诉拜登台湾是双边关系中最大、最危险的问题
item.description:
Chinese President Xi Jinping told U.S. President Joe Biden during their four-hour meeting on Wednesday that Taiwan was the biggest, most dangerous issue in U.S.-China ties, a senior U.S. official told reporters.翻译:一位美国高级官员对记者表示，中国国家主席习近平在周三与美国总统乔·拜登进行的四个小时的会晤中告诉美国总统拜登，台湾是美中关系中最大、最危险的问题。

The official quoted Xi as saying China's preference was for peaceful "reunification" with the Chinese-claimed island of Taiwan, but that he went on to talk about conditions in which force could be used.翻译:这位官员援引习近平的话说，中国更倾向于与中国声称拥有主权的台湾岛和平“统一”，但他接着谈到了可以使用武力的条件。

Xi was trying to indicate that China is not preparing for a massive invasion of Taiwan, but that does not change the U.S. approach, the official said.翻译:这位官员表示，习近平试图表明中国没有准备大规模入侵台湾，但这并没有改变美国的做法。

"President Xi ... underscored that this was the biggest, most potentially dangerous issue in U.S.-China relations, laid out clearly that, you know, their preference was for peaceful reunification but then moved immediately to conditions that the potential use of force could be utilized," the senior U.S. official told reporters, referring to Xi's comments on Taiwan.翻译:“习主席......强调这是美中关系中最大、最具潜在危险的问题，明确指出，你知道，他们倾向于和平统一，但随后立即转向可能使用武力的条件被利用”，这位美国高级官员在谈到习近平对台湾的评论时告诉记者。

Biden responded by assuring Xi that Washington was determined to maintain peace in the region.翻译:拜登的回应是向习近平保证华盛顿决心维护该地区的和平。

"President Biden responded very clearly that the long-standing position of the United States was ... determination to maintain peace and stability," the official said.翻译:这位官员表示：“拜登总统的回应非常明确，美国的长期立场是……维护和平与稳定的决心。”

"President Xi responded: look, peace is ... all well and good but at some point we need to move towards resolution more generally," the official said.翻译:这位官员表示：“习主席回应道：看，和平……一切都很好，但在某些时候我们需要更广泛地解决问题。”

China has long taken a carrot and stick approach towards Taiwan, both promising to work for peaceful "reunification" at the same time as threatening force. In the past year and a half China has staged two large-scale war games around the island.翻译:中国长期以来对台湾采取胡萝卜加大棒的政策，既承诺致力于和平“统一”，同时又以武力相威胁。一年半来，中国已连续举行两场大规模环岛军演。

Taiwan's foreign ministry, responding to the Biden-Xi meeting, said the government has never sought to predict whether or when China might attack but was concentrating on boosting its defenses and winning international support.翻译:台湾外交部在回应拜登与习近平的会晤时表示，政府从未试图预测中国是否或何时会发动攻击，而是集中精力加强防御并赢得国际支持。

This is to "let China understand the high importance the international community attaches to peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait, the high price of starting a war, and to not act blindly without thinking," ministry spokesperson Jeff Liu said in Taipei.翻译:国防部发言人刘杰夫在台北表示，这是为了“让中国了解国际社会对台海和平稳定的高度重视，以及发动战争的高昂代价，而不是不经过思考就盲目行动”。

Taiwan will neither provoke nor "advance rashly" but will also not succumb to pressure, Liu said.翻译:刘说，台湾不会挑衅，也不会“贸然前进”，但也不会屈服于压力。

Biden and Xi met for the first time in a year on Wednesday for talks aimed at easingfriction between the two superpowers over military conflicts, drug-trafficking and artificial intelligence, and said they had made "real progress."翻译:周三，拜登和习近平一年来首次会面，进行会谈，旨在缓解两个超级大国之间在军事冲突、 贩毒和人工智能方面的摩擦，并表示双方取得了“真正的进展”。

China has stepped up military activity to try and force democratically governed Taiwan to accept Beijing's sovereignty, despite strong objections from Taipei government, which says only the island's people can decide their future.翻译:中国加强了军事活动，试图迫使民主治理的台湾接受北京的主权，尽管台北政府强烈反对，称只有台湾人民才能决定他们的未来。

Senior U.S. military officers have said that Xi has ordered the People's Liberation Army to be prepared to invade Taiwan by 2027. Beijing has not ruled out using force to take the island, though it has never shared details about war preparations.翻译:美国高级军官表示，习近平已命令中国人民解放军做好2027年入侵台湾的准备。北京并未排除使用武力夺取台湾岛的可能性，但从未透露过战争准备的细节。

Reporting by Trevor Hunnicutt and Jeff Mason; Additional reporting by Ben Blanchard in Taipei; Writing by Andrea Shalal; Editing by Sandra Maler, Stephen Coates and Tom Hogue翻译:特雷弗·亨尼卡特和杰夫·梅森的报道； Ben Blanchard 在台北的补充报道；安德里亚·沙拉尔 (Andrea Shalal) 撰写；桑德拉·马勒 (Sandra Maler)、斯蒂芬·科茨 (Stephen Coates) 和汤姆·霍格 (Tom Hogue) 编辑

item.title: 美国、中国和东南亚防务官员在危机中会面
item.description:
Defence ministers and officials from the United States, China, Russia and Southeast Asia gathered in Indonesia on Thursday for a meeting where they are expected to discuss geopolitical crises in and outside the region.翻译:来自美国、中国、俄罗斯和东南亚的国防部长和官员周四齐聚印度尼西亚举行会议，预计他们将讨论该地区内外的地缘政治危机。

Defence ministers in Southeast Asia's regional bloc ASEAN called on Wednesday for a ceasefire in Gaza and a durable solution in Myanmar, as conflicts are deepening there.翻译:东南亚地区集团东盟的国防部长周三呼吁加沙停火，并在缅甸寻求持久解决方案，因为那里的冲突正在加深。

"Indonesia is of the view that the region's multiple security issues, ranging from traditional and non-traditional threats, can only be solved by extensive open and inclusive global collaboration," Prabowo Subianto, Indonesia's defence minister said in an opening speech on Thursday.翻译:印度尼西亚国防部长普拉博沃·苏比安托 (Prabowo Subianto) 在周四的开幕致辞中表示：“印度尼西亚认为，该地区的多重安全问题，包括传统威胁和非传统威胁，只能通过广泛开放和包容的全球合作来解决。”

Prabowo did not mention any specific issues in the speech, but he named on Wednesday the South China Sea, the Korean Peninsula and Myanmar as "hot spots that can destabilise the region."翻译:普拉博沃在讲话中没有提及任何具体问题，但他周三将南海、朝鲜半岛和缅甸列为“可能破坏该地区稳定的热点地区”。

Among those attending are U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin, Russia's Deputy Defence Minister Alexander Fomin and Jing Jianfeng, China's deputy chief of staff of the Joint Staff Department of the Central Military Commission.翻译:出席会议的包括美国国防部长劳埃德·奥斯汀、俄罗斯国防部副部长亚历山大·福明和中国中央军委联合参谋部副参谋长景剑锋。

Other countries participating on Thursday are Australia, New Zealand and others, while Myanmar is absent.翻译:周四参加的其他国家有澳大利亚、新西兰等，但缅甸缺席。

Myanmar's generals have been barred from high-level meetings of the 10-member ASEAN since they seized power in a 2021 coup and unleashed violence on those who challenged their takeover.翻译:自从缅甸在 2021 年政变中夺取政权并向那些挑战其接管权的人发动暴力以来，缅甸将军们一直被禁止参加由 10 个成员国组成的东盟高级别会议。

The meeting comes as U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese leader Xi Jinping met on Wednesday on the outskirts of San Francisco, where they agreed to resume military-to-military communications and work to curb fentanyl production.翻译:这次会议召开之际，美国总统乔·拜登和中国领导人习近平周三在旧金山郊区会面，同意恢复军队间的沟通并努力遏制芬太尼的生产。

Indonesia and Malaysia have also called for a ceasefire in the ongoing conflict in Gaza. Visiting Washington this week, Indonesian President Joko Widodo pressed Biden to do more to end Israel's war with Hamas.翻译:印度尼西亚和马来西亚也呼吁加沙持续冲突停火。印度尼西亚总统佐科·维多多本周访问华盛顿， 敦促拜登采取更多措施结束以色列与哈马斯的战争。

Reporting by Stanley Widianto; Editing by Lincoln Feast翻译:斯坦利·维迪安托报道；林肯·盛宴编辑

item.title: 习近平会见乔·拜登时APEC示威焦点
item.description:
A demonstrator draped in a Free Tibet flag climbed a flagpole in front of the hotel where Chinese President Xi Jinping was due to meet with U.S. CEOs on Wednesday evening, capping a day of demonstrations against, and for, the Chinese leader.翻译:一名身披自由西藏旗帜的示威者爬上中国国家主席习近平周三晚上会见美国首席执行官的酒店前的旗杆，结束了一天反对和支持中国领导人的示威活动。

Protesters of the Israel-Hamas war, critics of the global response to climate change and other causes all turned out for the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum in San Francisco, where global leaders and CEOs offered tempting targets.翻译:以色列-哈马斯战争的抗议者、全球应对气候变化和其他原因的批评者都聚集在旧金山举行的亚太经济合作组织（APEC）论坛上，全球领导人和首席执行官提出了诱人的目标。

The day began with a couple of hundred protesters obstructing San Francisco streets and entrances to the convention center area for the meetings.翻译:这一天开始时，数百名抗议者堵塞了旧金山的街道和会议中心区域的入口。

But the focus of demonstrators shifted more towards anti- and pro-China during the day.翻译:但白天示威者的焦点更多地转向反华和亲华。

Hundreds of critics of Xi marched through downtown around noon, a major protest against the leader. They moved through the city's center, chanting "free Tibet" and "free Hong Kong."翻译:中午时分，数百名习近平批评者在市中心游行，这是对这位领导人的大规模抗议。他们穿过市中心，高呼“自由西藏”和“自由香港”。

Headed by a police escort, the peaceful group - which stretched for multiple city blocks - blocked one of the main downtown thoroughfares, as it moved in a slow circle around the convention center's perimeter.翻译:在警察护送的带领下，这群和平的团体绵延多个街区，封锁了市中心的一条主干道，并绕着会议中心周边缓慢移动。

“We can say beyond a reasonable doubt that this will be the largest anti-Xi protest during the bilateral talks hosted here in the United States in the history of Xi Jinping’s time as a dictator of China,” Pema Doma, executive director of Students for a Free Tibet, said early in the day.翻译:“我们可以毫无疑问地说，这将是习近平作为中国独裁者时期历史上在美国举行的双边会谈期间最大规模的反习近平抗议活动，”学生组织执行主任佩玛·多马(Pema Doma)说。当天早些时候就说过“自由西藏”。

Still, local television showed crowds welcoming Xi, waving huge Chinese and American flags, as well as posters of the two flags together, along a highway south of San Francisco where the presidents met. Some protesters also lined that route.翻译:尽管如此，当地电视台还是显示，在两国总统会晤的旧金山以南的一条高速公路上，人群挥舞着巨大的中国和美国国旗，以及两国国旗并在一起的海报，欢迎习近平。一些抗议者也在这条路线上排队。

And in the evening, ahead of the meeting between Xi and U.S. CEOs, supporters and protesters initially both lined the street. That is where the flagpole climber took the message of Free Tibet up the pole.翻译:晚上，在习近平与美国首席执行官会面之前，支持者和抗议者最初都站在街道上。这就是旗杆攀登者将自由西藏的信息带到旗杆上的地方。

By midevening, a couple hundred pro-China supporters dominated the block, singing and waving flags.翻译:到了晚上，数百名亲中国支持者占据了整个街区，一边唱歌一边挥舞旗帜。

Demonstrators for non-Chinese causes have been active since at least Sunday, some crowds stretching for blocks. The group early on Wednesday formed a human chain that prevented some conference attendees from walking through the intersection.翻译:至少从周日开始，支持非华人事业的示威者就一直很活跃， 一些人群甚至延伸到了几个街区。周三早些时候，该组织形成了一条人链，阻止一些与会者穿过十字路口。

"I'm actually kind of impressed by the fact that there's so few people here and they've actually kind of gummed up the works a little bit," said Gary Hughes from the advocacy group Biofuelwatch.翻译:“事实上，这里的人很少，而且他们实际上有点搞砸了，这一事实给我留下了深刻的印象，”倡导组织生物燃料观察的加里·休斯说。

Protesters held signs that said "War criminals out of SF" and "From Palestine to the Philippines stop the US war machine."翻译:抗议者举着标语，上面写着“战犯滚出旧金山”和“从巴勒斯坦到菲律宾，阻止美国战争机器”。

Police donned protective helmets, but there were no major clashes.翻译:警察戴上了防护头盔，但没有发生重大冲突。

San Francisco has cleaned up downtown streets for the meeting, and it had prepared for potential confrontation with demonstrators: eight-foot-high (2.4-meter-high) metal mesh barriers have been erected to keep people on sidewalks from interfering with vehicle traffic near the convention center.翻译:旧金山已经为会议清理了市中心街道，并为可能与示威者发生对抗做好了准备：已经竖起八英尺高（2.4米高）的金属网屏障，以防止人行道上的人们干扰附近的车辆交通会议中心。

The potential for disruptions around the summit site, portions of which were shut to vehicles and foot traffic, led the U.S. Department of Homeland Security to designate the meeting a national special security event, putting the U.S. Secret Service in charge of coordination of policing agencies.翻译:由于峰会地点周围可能出现干扰，其中部分地点禁止车辆和行人通行，美国国土安全部将此次会议指定为国家特别安全活动，并由美国特勤局负责协调警务机构。

item.title: 要点 - 拜登和习近平会面：台湾、伊朗、芬太尼和人工智能
item.description:
U.S. President Joe Biden and China's Xi Jinping met for about four hours on Wednesday to discuss issues ranging from military conflicts to drug-trafficking.翻译:美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平周三会面约四个小时，讨论从军事冲突到贩毒等一系列问题。

Biden welcomed the Chinese leader at the Filoli estate, a country house and gardens about 30 miles (48 km) south of San Francisco, ahead of a summit of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum.翻译:在亚太经济合作组织 (APEC) 论坛峰会召开之前，拜登在位于旧金山以南约 30 英里（48 公里）的菲洛丽庄园欢迎中国领导人。菲洛丽庄园是一座乡村别墅和花园。

Here's the key issues discussed.

TAIWAN

The two leaders had a "substantial" discussion on Taiwan, with Xi telling Biden that Taiwan was the biggest, most dangerous issue facing the two superpowers, a senior U.S. official told reporters.翻译:一位美国高级官员告诉记者，两位领导人就台湾问题进行了“实质性”讨论，习近平告诉拜登，台湾是两个超级大国面临的最大、最危险的问题。

The Chinese leader said that China had no plans for military action against Taiwan in coming years, but also discussed conditions under which force could be used, the official said.翻译:这位官员表示，这位中国领导人表示，中国没有计划在未来几年对台湾采取军事行动，但也讨论了可以使用武力的条件。

Biden said he "stressed the importance of peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait." He also asked Xi to respect Taiwan's electoral process, the U.S. official said.翻译:拜登表示，他“强调了台海和平与稳定的重要性”。这位美国官员表示，他还要求习近平尊重台湾的选举程序。

Xi responded: "Look, peace is ... all well and good but at some point we need to move towards resolution more generally," the U.S. official said.

MILITARY TALKS

Beijing said the two leaders agreed to resume military contacts that China severed after then-House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan in August 2022.翻译:北京表示，两国领导人同意恢复中国在时任众议院议长南希·佩洛西于 2022 年 8 月访问台湾后中断的军事接触。

Biden made a "very clear request" that both countries institutionalize the military-to-military dialogues, and U.S. Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin will meet his Chinese counterpart when that person is named, a senior U.S. official said.

LEADER TO LEADER TALKS

Biden said he and Xi agreed to high-level communications.翻译:拜登表示，他和习近平同意进行高层沟通。

"He and I agreed that each one of us can pick up the phone call directly and we'll be heard immediately," Biden told reporters after the meeting.

COOPERATION AND CONCILIATION

Beijing's report of the meeting, via the Communist Party-controlled Chinese state media, emphasized the need for more cooperation, dialogue and respect. China and the United States should set an example for other countries, Xi told Biden, according to Chinese media, and promote cooperation on trade, agriculture, climate change and artificial intelligence.翻译:北京通过共产党控制的中国官方媒体对这次会议进行了报道，强调需要更多的合作、对话和尊重。据中国媒体报道，习近平告诉拜登，中美两国应为其他国家树立榜样，推动贸易、农业、气候变化和人工智能等领域的合作。

An official briefed on the talks said Beijing was also seeking a show of respect from the trip.

FENTANYL

Biden and Xi agreed to cooperate on addressing the source of the opioid fentanyl, a leading cause of drug overdoses in the United States, the U.S. official said.翻译:这位美国官员表示，拜登和习近平同意合作解决阿片类药物芬太尼的来源问题，阿片类药物芬太尼是美国吸毒过量的主要原因。

Under the agreement, China will go directly after specific chemical companies that make fentanyl precursors.

IRAN

The two leaders also discussed the unfolding crisis in the Middle East, with Biden asking China to weigh in with Iran and urge it to avoid steps that could be seen as provocative, the senior U.S. official told reporters.翻译:这位美国高级官员告诉记者，两位领导人还讨论了中东正在发生的危机，拜登要求中国对伊朗发表意见，并敦促其避免采取可能被视为挑衅的行动。

Chinese officials told the U.S. side that they had engaged in discussions with Iran on regional risks.

ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE

The two leaders also discussed artificial intelligence (AI)and agreed that AI was used in military or nuclear operations, it created real risks.翻译:两位领导人还讨论了人工智能（AI），并一致认为人工智能用于军事或核行动，会带来真正的风险。

The senior U.S. official said both sides were "very much focused" on practices regarding AI that could be dangerous or destabilizing, but not ready for any mutual declaration.翻译:这位美国高级官员表示，双方“非常关注”可能危险或破坏稳定的人工智能做法，但尚未准备好相互宣布。

item.title: 中国反对美国申请APEC以改变贸易和投资原则
item.description:
China is objecting to a U.S. proposal for Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) members to incorporate sustainability and inclusivity into their trade and investment policies, a source briefed on the negotiations said on Wednesday.翻译:一位了解谈判情况的消息人士周三表示，中国反对美国提出的亚太经合组织（APEC）成员将可持续性和包容性纳入其贸易和投资政策的提议。

Talks on the issue were continuing at the APEC summit in San Francisco翻译:APEC峰会在旧金山举行 to try to find language that the group's 21 member states could agree on, the source said.

U.S. Trade Representative Katherine Tai told a trade-focused plenary meeting she hoped the proposal, dubbed by the Biden administration as the "San Francisco Principles for Integrating Inclusivity and Sustainability into Trade and Investment Policy" could be still be finalized.翻译:美国贸易代表凯瑟琳·戴在一次以贸易为重点的全体会议上表示，她希望这项被拜登政府称为“将包容性和可持续性纳入贸易和投资政策的旧金山原则”的提案仍能最终确定。

Tai said the U.S.-led effort was "supported by all economies but one and, as such, it is unclear if APEC will fulfill that mandate. Nonetheless, I remain optimistic that economies will finalize the San Francisco Principles soon."翻译:戴表示，美国主导的努力“得到了除一个经济体之外的所有经济体的支持，因此，目前尚不清楚亚太经合组织是否会履行这一使命。尽管如此，我仍然乐观地认为各经济体将很快敲定《旧金山原则》。”

Few details of the U.S. proposal were available, but the Biden administration is promoting the idea that APEC economies increase opportunities for more people, particularly disadvantaged populations, and to incorporate clean energy and carbon emissions reductions goals into their development, growth and trade policies.翻译:美国提案的细节很少，但拜登政府正在宣扬这样的想法：APEC经济体为更多人，特别是弱势群体增加机会，并将清洁能源和碳减排目标纳入其发展、增长和贸易政策。

"Our economies are more than just numbers," Tai said when describing the U.S. proposal. "They are made of people, so we need to make sure that our economic and trade policies work for our people and that the benefits created are shared by all."翻译:“我们的经济不仅仅是数字，”戴在描述美国的提议时说。 “它们是由人组成的，因此我们需要确保我们的经济和贸易政策适合我们的人民，并确保所创造的利益由所有人共享。”

Tai is separately seeking to negotiate a green steel arrangement with the European Union that aims to disadvantage Chinese steelmakers on the basis of their higher carbon emissions.翻译:戴秉国正在单独寻求与欧盟谈判一项绿色钢铁安排，旨在使中国钢铁制造商因碳排放量较高而处于不利地位。

News of China's objections at the APEC summit come as U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping met south of San Francisco in high-stakes talks that included discussions between the superpowers over Taiwan and the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza.翻译:中国反对亚太经合组织峰会的消息传出之际，美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平在旧金山以南举行了高风险会谈，会谈内容包括两个超级大国之间关于台湾问题和以色列与哈马斯在加沙战争的讨论。

A spokesperson for China's embassy in Washington did not directly address China's objections but said that all APEC parties should "focus on the region's urgent needs, deepen solidarity and cooperation, deliver on the APEC Putrajaya Vision 2040 in an all-round and balanced way," a reference to declarations by APEC leaders in 2020 in Malaysia.翻译:中国驻华盛顿大使馆发言人没有直接回应中方的反对意见，但表示APEC各方应“聚焦本地区迫切需要，深化团结合作，全面平衡落实APEC布城2040愿景”。参考 2020 年 APEC 领导人在马来西亚发表的宣言。

The Putrajaya vision called for working to "deliver a free, open, fair, non-discriminatory, transparent and predictable trade and investment environment."翻译:布城愿景呼吁努力“提供自由、开放、公平、非歧视、透明和可预测的贸易和投资环境”。

item.title: 意大利打击从中国走私芬太尼至美国逮捕六人
item.description:
Italian police have arrested six people in a crackdown on a network that allegedly played go-between for fentanyl trafficking from China to the United States, Guardia di Finanza police and prosecutors in the northern city of Piacenza said on Wednesday.翻译:北部城市皮亚琴察的金融警卫队警方和检察官周三表示，意大利警方在打击一个涉嫌从中国向美国贩运芬太尼的网络中逮捕了六人。

"It was really good work, achieved through direct cooperation with investigators from the U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA)," Piacenza chief prosecutor Grazia Pradella told Reuters, adding that U.S police arrested 11 other people and seized 2 kg of the synthetic drug.翻译:皮亚琴察首席检察官格拉齐亚·普拉德拉 (Grazia Pradella) 告诉路透社：“这确实是一项出色的工作，是通过与美国缉毒局 (DEA) 调查人员的直接合作完成的。”他补充说，美国警方逮捕了另外 11 人，并缴获了 2 公斤合成毒品。

Washington is hoping to secure more cooperation from Beijing in combating production of the potent synthetic opioid fentanyl, a scourge in the United States, when President Joe Biden meets Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday.翻译:当乔·拜登总统周三会见中国国家主席习近平时，华盛顿希望获得北京方面的更多合作，打击强效合成阿片类药物芬太尼的生产，芬太尼在美国是一个祸害。

The rate of drug overdose deaths involving fentanyl more than tripled from 2016 through 2021 in the U.S, according to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).翻译:根据美国疾病控制与预防中心 (CDC) 的数据，从 2016 年到 2021 年，美国涉及芬太尼的药物过量死亡率增加了两倍多。

Among those arrested in Italy is the alleged head of the network, a 51-year-old Italian man suspected of buying fentanyl from China over the past three years. He sold it on to buyers in the United States, and in one case in Mexico, the chief prosecutor said.翻译:在意大利被捕的人中有一名被指控为该网络负责人的人，他是一名 51 岁的意大利男子，涉嫌在过去三年从中国购买芬太尼。首席检察官表示，他将其卖给了美国的买家，其中还包括墨西哥的买家。

The investigation began in April after a report sent by the DEA liaison officer at the U.S. embassy in Rome, Guardia di Finanza police said in a statement, adding the fentanyl arrived in Piacenza inside packages sent from China and labelled as containing electronics or books.翻译:Guardia di Finanza警方在一份声明中表示，美国驻罗马大使馆缉毒局联络官发出报告后，调查于四月开始，并补充说，芬太尼装在从中国寄出的包裹中抵达皮亚琴察，并贴有电子产品或书籍的标签。

Police said they were able to trace 100,000 packaged doses and that related economic transactions amounting to more than 250,000 euros ($275,000) took place through untraceable payment instruments using cryptocurrency.翻译:警方表示，他们能够追踪到 100,000 个包装剂量，并且通过使用加密货币的无法追踪的支付工具进行了价值超过 250,000 欧元（275,000 美元）的相关经济交易。

The judge in Piacenza had ordered seven arrests but a Ukrainian national is a fugitive and international law enforcement agencies have been alerted to track him down, police said.翻译:警方表示，皮亚琴察的法官已下令逮捕七人，但一名乌克兰国民是逃犯，国际执法机构已接到通知追查他。

Italian police also found that the group had minted near-perfect fake Swiss coins, smuggled them across the border to Switzerland where they laundered them through automated sports betting machines and bitcoin ATMs.翻译:意大利警方还发现，该团伙铸造了近乎完美的假瑞士硬币，并将其偷运至瑞士，并通过自动体育博彩机和比特币 ATM 机进行洗钱。

The conversion of bitcoins back into euros was then entrusted to people in Eastern Europe who would return the "cleaned" sum minus 7% commission to the counterfeiter in Piacenza.翻译:然后，将比特币兑换回欧元的工作委托给东欧的人，他们将“干净”的金额减去 7% 的佣金返还给皮亚琴察的造假者。

Police said they seized 300,000 euros in cash, about 26,000 euros in bitcoin, 70 computer devices and three valuable watches, as well as a property and the equipment for counterfeiting currency. ($1 = 0.9207 euros)翻译:警方称，他们查获了 30 万欧元现金、约 2.6 万欧元比特币、70 台电脑设备和三块贵重手表，以及一处财产和用于伪造货币的设备。 （1 美元 = 0.9207 欧元）
